To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

nodes.body:

* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11600~~

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Is there a reason you only setup the topology and not the uniform structure? If that's because it's too annoying, I agree, and I'd be happy to help.
This needs some love, but then I'm happy to get it in.
This needs some love, but then I'm happy to get it in.

```suggestion
sometimes also called the *strong operator topology*. We avoid this terminology
since so many other things share similar names, and using "pointwise convergence"
in the name is more informative.
```
Is there precedence for using `LM` like this (without `C`)? I think this should probably just be called `coeLinearMap` or `toLinearMap`.
I think the `â‚›` is for "strong". Either we need to say it somewhere, or else use something slightly more descriptive, like `â‚šâ‚œ`.
I guess you know this isn't done?
Yes, I forgot to add the dependency on the other PR.

I think you'll make your life easier by adding these two lemmas right after [UniformOnFun.uniformContinuous_restrict](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/UniformSpace/UniformConvergenceTopology.html#UniformOnFun.uniformContinuous_restrict)
```lean
theorem uniformEmbedding_toFun_finite :
    UniformEmbedding (toFun _ : (Î± â†’áµ¤[{s | s.Finite}] Î²) â†’ (Î± â†’ Î²)) := by
  refine âŸ¨âŸ¨?_âŸ©, Function.injective_idâŸ©
  simp_rw [Pi.uniformity, comap_iInf, comap_comap]
  refine HasBasis.ext (hasBasis_iInf' fun i â†¦ (Filter.basis_sets _).comap _)
    (UniformOnFun.hasBasis_uniformity Î± Î² _ âŸ¨âˆ…, finite_emptyâŸ©
      (directedOn_of_sup_mem fun _ _ â†¦ .union))
    (fun âŸ¨S, UâŸ© âŸ¨hS, hUâŸ© â†¦ âŸ¨âŸ¨S, â‹‚ x âˆˆ S, U xâŸ©, âŸ¨âŸ¨hS, biInter_mem hS |>.mpr hUâŸ©,
      fun f hf â†¦ mem_iInterâ‚‚.mpr fun x hx â†¦ mem_iInterâ‚‚.mp (hf x hx) x hxâŸ©âŸ©)
    (fun âŸ¨S, UâŸ© âŸ¨hS, hUâŸ© â†¦ âŸ¨âŸ¨S, fun _ â†¦ UâŸ©, âŸ¨hS, fun _ _ â†¦ hUâŸ©, fun f hf x hx â†¦
      mem_iInterâ‚‚.mp hf x hxâŸ©)

theorem embedding_toFun_finite :
    Embedding (toFun _ : (Î± â†’áµ¤[{s | s.Finite}] Î²) â†’ (Î± â†’ Î²)) :=
  (uniformEmbedding_toFun_finite Î± Î²).embedding
```
and then adding to the current file
```lean
variable (Ïƒ E F) in
protected theorem embedding_coeFn : Embedding ((â†‘) : (E â†’SLâ‚šâ‚œ[Ïƒ] F) â†’ (E â†’ F)) :=
  let _: UniformSpace F := TopologicalAddGroup.toUniformSpace F
  have _ : UniformAddGroup F := comm_topologicalAddGroup_is_uniform
  (UniformOnFun.embedding_toFun_finite E F).comp (UniformConvergenceCLM.embedding_coeFn Ïƒ F _)
```

This and the corresponding result about `UniformConvergenceCLM` will allow you to use any piece of API about product topologies and uniform convergence topologies, which mean you wouldn't have to do any nontrivial proofs I think.

E.g this particular lemma would follow immediately from [Inducing.tendsto_nhds_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Maps.html#Inducing.tendsto_nhds_iff) and [tendsto_pi_nhds](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Constructions.html#tendsto_pi_nhds), the one about continuity from [Inducing.continuous_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Maps.html#Inducing.continuous_iff) and [continuous_pi_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Constructions.html#continuous_pi_iff), etc...

pullRequest.title: feat: Topology of pointwise convergence for continuous linear maps
